Okay,

    What I am going to do is post an excep from the rules section on=
 the
wikisite. The link for this is: http://www.wikihost.org/w/nbwrpg_wiki/=
tools/

And the rule is as follows:

**************************************=
*********

*Rules*

*1. No Moding! Moding (aka god-moding) is where you wri=
te an action for
another person's character or property. You can only post =
for yourself and
your property.

**Examples:

If you are in combat with ano=
ther bot, you cannot say something like "He
fires three shots, hitting XBot=
 in the chest and breaking off one of his
wings." What you say is "He fires=
 three shots at XBot with his pistol,
aiming for the chest."

If you are in=
side a base, it is likely someone or several people control
that base. Don'=
t say "My character blows down the door and forces his way
into the room." =
You CAN say "My character attempts to blow down the door by
placing explosi=
ves outside."
Be realistic. Your character should have some reason to have =
explosives on
him, make sure its listed in the character's bio that he has =
them or make
sure you post earlier explaining where it came from. If you wa=
nt to do a
more elaborate plot, it would be wise to contact the owners of t=
hat
property.
*
**************************************************
*
*
*Ple=
ase, when performing an action, whether it is a combat action or an
action =
that would affect someone elses property (like forcing open doors on
someon=
e's base), just post an attempt to do this, and then wait for the
owner to =
post the reaction to that attempt. Yes, it may have taken two or
three post=
s to get through, but It makes it more fun for us all, and we all
remain in=
volved in the RP. :)

Thanks :)

Preston

ty section attempting to cordinate its defenses, while

ift are in the throne room with Hydras, Scourge, Scorponok

 and now Perceptor.
>
> I have some thinking to do before I post. Will post=
 later.
>
> Preston

llapsed due to extreme exhaustion and some moderate burn

e magma. Yes, even magma didn't stopp him from trying to help

es. He's got some burn marks in his armor, and that's his damaged
>> state =
for now.
>>
>>
>> BIC:
>>
>> Perhaps the power he had extended outward, was=
 in vain. Tucson lies on the
>> ground for a moment or so, but slowly rolls=
 back up onto his left side,
>> holding up his upper body with his arms whi=
ch shake under the sheer pressure
>> of his weight. He looks around, and fi=
nds Darkhawk, severely weakened by the
>> powerful blast. Night Shift waste=
s no time in slapping a pair of stasis
>> cuffs on Darkhawk, who in reality=
 was Windlord.
>>
>> "Gotchya. Don't worry, you're in good hands now. Yo, K=
up! Better take this
>> guy for me, I think Tucson Prime's commn' around."
=
>>
>> Tucson calmly looks around yet with a stern expression on his face.
>=
>
>> "Not - the result I was hoping for but - it did enable us to get
>> so=
mewhere. Can't - have it all I suppose, but doesn't mean we're giving up
>>=
 all together."
>>
>> Slowly he makes it onto his knees, and then plants on=
e foot down on the
>> ground, hoisting himself up to his feet, with a bit o=
f a stumble. He was
>> weak, extremely weak, and it was questionable wether=
 or not he would be able
>> to continue fighting. He didn't want anyone to =
see him in such a condition
>> though. He fights his weakness and tries to =
shrug off the grogginess he
>> feels. Night Shift nodds in agreement with T=
ucson Prime.
>>
>> " I hear ya on that one big bot. Sometimes, ya win some,=
 ya lose some, and
>> sometimes it's kinda like in the middle of both losn'=
 and winn'n."
>>
>> Tucson understood that the mission itself would be diff=
icult so he
>> prepared himself for the unexpected by working with that unc=
ertainty that
>> plans don't always go as they are intended. He shrugs off =
the fact that
>> Cyclonus is not even scathed by the energy attack. He was =
now curious about
>> Rodimus and how he had handled it.
>>
>> " Something -=
 Rodimus wasn't too good at doing. I have a feeling he may
>> not have take=
n this too well, Nightshift."
>>
>> Nightshift narrows his optics.
>>
>> " =
Lemme tell ya somethn' Tucson, before you became a Prime, and he was on
>> =
the job, it didn't look like his spark was totally in his work. But you, th=
e
>> quiet guy in the corner, the guy who threw caution ta the wind ta save=
 his
>> comrades, the guy who faces adversity as it comes and ain't afraid =
of it,
>> and the guy who actually learned from his loss rather than compla=
in'n about
>> it. You got what it takes, and always had it. It - just wasn'=
t obvious
>> because you're too modest for your own good and you kinda just=
 kept ta
>> yourself most of the time."
>>
>> Tucson listens thoughtfully t=
o Nightshift.
>>
>> " You're right, I wasn't much for words at the time... =
But back then, I
>> wanted to approach Rodimus on his not so pleasurable at=
titude on his
>> position as a Prime. It seemed as if he didn't want it. An=
d you know,
>> responsibility isn't for everyone. And for some, it's second=
 nature."
>>
>> Night Shift nodds.
>>
>> " Understandable. Now I admit, I d=
unno if I could ever take your job big
>> guy. Not that I ain't capable of =
it, I know I ain't a good match for the
>> position. And I ain't afraid ta =
admit that."
>>
>> Tucson Prime nodds once, and studies Cyclonus once more.=
 Something dawns
>> on him. He seemed relieved to be free of something.
>>
=
>> "Is it me Cyclonus or do you appear to be liberated of something that ma=
y
>> have been holding you back? Why do you work with Hydras anyway? What i=
s the
>> purpose of working with him when you can be your own individual? Y=
our life
>> should be as you intended, and not what others have intended fo=
r you. It
>> boils down to freedom. You have the chance to experience freed=
om. If I were
>> you I'd take that chance now. As a matter of fact, Scorpon=
ok, Scourge, what
>> seems to be holding you two back here, when you yourse=
lves can be your own
>> individuals as Decepticons? Does Hydras have you on=
 some sort of leash? I
>> see no such restraints so that means if you want =
freedom you should also
>> take it."
>>
>> Night Shift could see what Tucso=
n was up to. It was one of his thinking
>> outside the box kind of strategi=
es. And a strategy that would benefit all
>> and not just one faction. Tucs=
on was trying to break new ground, and as
>> crazy as it all looked, he sit=
s back to watch it all take place. Tucson
>> Prime now steps asside and wai=
ts to see if any of them either try to destroy
>> him, or actually agree wi=
th what he was trying to tell them.
>>
>> "Whatever any of you chose, your =
decision is your own and I will not
>> interfere. We may not be allies, but=
 I do respect the need for one's free
>> will. But if you attack me, do not=
 expect me to be so forgiving."
>>

%40yahoogroups.com>, Preston Carroll

He nodded, satisfied

ed back at Nightlight

 grinding of gears he shifted into his vehicular mode and opened
>> his doo=
r.

ct you.

that is

d on his lights and once Nightlight had gotten in he took

 rubber as he moved!

 be unaware of Tuscon's

ing everyone together.

n

<div class=3D"headline"><a name=3D"headline6"><=
/a><span class=3D"hl3"><strong>Rules</strong></span></div>
<div><br><strong=
><span class=3D"bold">1. No Moding!</span> Moding (aka god-moding) is where=
 you write an action for another person's character or property. You ca=
n only post for yourself and your property.<br><br></strong><strong><span c=
lass=3D"italic">Examples:<br>
<br>If you are in combat with another bot, yo=
u cannot say something like "He fires three shots, hitting XBot in the=
 chest and breaking off one of his wings." What you say is "He fi=
res three shots at XBot with his pistol, aiming for the chest."<br>
<b=
r>If you are inside a base, it is likely someone or several people control =
that base. Don't say "My character blows down the door and forces =
his way into the room." You CAN say "My character attempts to blo=
w down the door by placing explosives outside."<br>
Be realistic. Your=
 character should have some reason to have explosives on him, make sure its=
 listed in the character's bio that he has them or make sure you post e=
arlier explaining where it came from. If you want to do a more elaborate pl=
ot, it would be wise to contact the owners of that property.</span><br>
</s=
trong></div>
<div><strong>*************************************************=
</strong></div>
<div><strong><br></strong>Please, when performing an action=
, whether it is a combat action or an action that would affect someone else=
s property (like forcing open doors on someone's base),=A0just post an =
attempt to do this, and then wait for the owner to post the reaction to tha=
t attempt. Yes, it may have taken two or three posts to get through, but It=
 makes it more fun for us all, and we all remain involved in the RP.=A0:)</=
div>

<div>=A0</div>
<div>Thanks :)</div>
<div>=A0</div>

<div>
<p>OOC: Tucson collapsed due to extreme exhaustion and some mo=
derate burn damages from the magma. Yes, even magma didn't stopp him fr=
om trying to help his comrades. He's got some burn marks in his armor, =
and that's his damaged state for now.</p>

<div>
<div></div>
<div><br><=
br>BIC: <br><br>Perhaps the power he had extended outward, was in vain. Tuc=
son lies on the ground for a moment or so, but slowly rolls back up onto hi=
s left side, holding up his upper body with his arms which shake under the =
sheer pressure of his weight. He looks around, and finds Darkhawk, severely=
 weakened by the powerful blast. Night Shift wastes no time in slapping a p=
air of stasis cuffs on Darkhawk, who in reality was Windlord.<br>
<br>&quot=
;Gotchya. Don't worry, you're in good hands now. Yo, Kup! Better ta=
ke this guy for me, I think Tucson Prime's commn' around."<br>=
<br>Tucson calmly looks around yet with a stern expression on his face.<br>=

<br>"Not - the result I was hoping for but - it did enable us to get =
somewhere. Can't - have it all I suppose, but doesn't mean we'r=
e giving up all together."<br><br>Slowly he makes it onto his knees, a=
nd then plants one foot down on the ground, hoisting himself up to his feet=
, with a bit of a stumble. He was weak, extremely weak, and it was question=
able wether or not he would be able to continue fighting. He didn't wan=
t anyone to see him in such a condition though. He fights his weakness and =
tries to shrug off the grogginess he feels. Night Shift nodds in agreement =
with Tucson Prime. <br>
<br>" I hear ya on that one big bot. Sometimes=
, ya win some, ya lose some, and sometimes it's kinda like in the middl=
e of both losn' and winn'n."<br><br>Tucson understood that the=
 mission itself would be difficult so he prepared himself for the unexpecte=
d by working with that uncertainty that plans don't always go as they a=
re intended. He shrugs off the fact that Cyclonus is not even scathed by th=
e energy attack. He was now curious about Rodimus and how he had handled it=
. <br>
<br>" Something - Rodimus wasn't too good at doing. I have =
a feeling he may not have taken this too well, Nightshift."<br><br>Nig=
htshift narrows his optics.<br><br>" Lemme tell ya somethn' Tucson=
, before you became a Prime, and he was on the job, it didn't look like=
 his spark was totally in his work. But you, the quiet guy in the corner, t=
he guy who threw caution ta the wind ta save his comrades, the guy who face=
s adversity as it comes and ain't afraid of it, and the guy who actuall=
y learned from his loss rather than complain'n about it. You got what i=
t takes, and always had it. It - just wasn't obvious because you're=
 too modest for your own good and you kinda just kept ta yourself most of t=
he time."<br>
<br>Tucson listens thoughtfully to Nightshift.<br><br>&q=
uot; You're right, I wasn't much for words at the time... But back =
then, I wanted to approach Rodimus on his not so pleasurable attitude on hi=
s position as a Prime. It seemed as if he didn't want it. And you know,=
 responsibility isn't for everyone. And for some, it's second natur=
e."<br>
<br>Night Shift nodds.<br><br>" Understandable. Now I adm=
it, I dunno if I could ever take your job big guy. Not that I ain't cap=
able of it, I know I ain't a good match for the position. And I ain&#39=
;t afraid ta admit that."<br>
<br>Tucson Prime nodds once, and studies=
 Cyclonus once more. Something dawns on him. He seemed relieved to be free =
of something. <br><br>"Is it me Cyclonus or do you appear to be libera=
ted of something that may have been holding you back? Why do you work with =
Hydras anyway? What is the purpose of working with him when you can be your=
 own individual? Your life should be as you intended, and not what others h=
ave intended for you. It boils down to freedom. You have the chance to expe=
rience freedom. If I were you I'd take that chance now. As a matter of =
fact, Scorponok, Scourge, what seems to be holding you two back here, when =
you yourselves can be your own individuals as Decepticons? Does Hydras have=
 you on some sort of leash? I see no such restraints so that means if you w=
ant freedom you should also take it."<br>
<br>Night Shift could see wh=
at Tucson was up to. It was one of his thinking outside the box kind of str=
ategies. And a strategy that would benefit all and not just one faction. Tu=
cson was trying to break new ground, and as crazy as it all looked, he sits=
 back to watch it all take place. Tucson Prime now steps asside and waits t=
o see if any of them either try to destroy him, or actually agree with what=
 he was trying to tell them.<br>
<br>"Whatever any of you chose, your =
decision is your own and I will not interfere. We may not be allies, but I =
do respect the need for one's free will. But if you attack me, do not e=
xpect me to be so forgiving."<br>
<br>--- In <a href=3D"mailto:nbwrpg%=
40yahoogroups.com" target=3D"_blank">nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com</a>, Preston Ca=
rroll <supercyclonus@...> wrote:<br>><br>> > Nightlight Nodd=
ed, she stood up with fear in her face. she was ready to follow Rodimus<br>=

> <br>> Rodimus tapped his code on the door and it slid open. He ste=
pped out<br>> of the chamber and looked around for a moment. He nodded, =
satisfied<br>> that there were no intruders in the hall. He looked back =
at Nightlight<br>
> and motioned for her to follow.<br>> <br>> Wit=
h a grinding of gears he shifted into his vehicular mode and opened his doo=
r.<br>> <br>> "Come on." he said as he gunned his engine. &=
quot;I will will protect you.<br>
> We need to head towards the throne r=
oom. If there is anywhere that is<br>> more protected in this place it i=
s there."<br>> <br>> He flipped on his lights and once Nightligh=
t had gotten in he took<br>> off, burning rubber as he moved!<br>
> <=
br>> OOC: Remember, Rodimus and Nightlight should be unaware of Tuscon&#=
39;s<br>> intrusion, so this since like a good way to bring everyone tog=
ether.<br>> Rodimus acting in ignorance :)<br>> <br>> Preston<br>
=
><br><br></div></div></div></div>
<div style=3D"MIN-HEIGHT: 0pt; COLOR: =
rgb(255,255,255)"></div></div></blockquote></div><br></blockquote></div><br=
>
